snippet: The arrests are likely to hurt the prospects for the national dialogue talks that were called by President Omar Hassan al-Bashir to ease tensions.
abstract: Sudanese authorities arrest Ibrahim al-Sheikh, leader of opposition Congress Party, after he delivers speech blaming government for violence in Darfur; incident follows arrest of opposition leader Sadiq al-Mahdi in May; arrests are likely to hurt prospect of dialogue talks intended to ease tensions among political parties ahead of 2015 elections.
lead_paragraph: The arrests are likely to hurt the prospects for the national dialogue talks that were called by President Omar Hassan al-Bashir to ease tensions.

headline.main: Sudanese Authorities Arrest Second Opposition Leader
headline.print_headline: Sudanese Authorities Arrest Second Opposition Leader
